Literature Review: Genetic data have revolutionized our understanding of human evolutionary history, providing a record of our population relationships and past migrations. The availability of large-scale datasets and advances in computational methods have enabled researchers to explore and characterize population relationships using genomic data. This review aims to provide an overview of widely used statistical methods for assessing population relationships and history, highlighting their intuition, interpretation, and limitations. We also discuss new frontiers in genomic methods to learn about population history, complementing knowledge from other disciplines such as archaeology, anthropology, and linguistics.
